title: authority
comment: The right to act or speak in certain ways, in accordance with the authorisation of a higher power. All human authority derives from God, and is to be exercised in a responsible manner.

children.title: authority, nature of
children.comment: The God-given freedom of action expressed in rightful power to control the actions of others.

children.title: Ultimate authority belongs to God, who does as he pleases

seealsos.comment: God's authority is demonstrated in election.

children.title: Human authority
All human authority is given and established by God
It involves the rightful freedom to give orders
It is limited, unlike God's authority
Responsibilities of those with authority
They are to act as servants, not lording it over people
Their authority is to be used for the benefit of others
It is sometimes necessary to withhold exercising authority for others' good
Examples of the authority of believers
Authority over possessions

primaryrefs.comment: Peter to Ananias regarding the land he sold.

children.title: Authority over the will
Authority to become children of God
The authority of the law over believers during their lifetime
authority, in the church
children.comment: The exercise of freedom under Jesus Christ's authority for the good of the church.

children.title: Supreme authority belongs to Jesus Christ as head of the church
Spiritual authority under Jesus Christ in the church is possessed by elders
As shepherds who teach and care for the flock
As overseers ruling the church

seealsos.comment: Those serving as overseers must rule their own homes well

children.title: The response of the church to the authority of elders
Elders are to be obeyed
Elders are to be honoured and respected
Paul limits the authority of women in the church

primaryrefs.comment: Some believe Paul's restriction to apply to the women in the Ephesian church who were seizing authority rather than having been granted it. Others believe Paul is prohibiting women from being official teachers in the assembled church.

children.title: The reason for this prohibition derives from God's order of creation
Kinds of authority within the church
Authority to preach the gospel
Authority to excommunicate

secondaryrefs.comment: ``hand this man over to Satan'' here means ``send back into the world ruled by Satan''

children.title: Authority to forgive sins
authority, in the home
children.comment: The exercise of God-given authority within the husband-wife and parent-child relationships.

children.title: A husband is given headship over his wife
The basis for this headship
God's headship over Jesus Christ
Jesus Christ's headship over the church
God's order of creation
This headship has been affected by the fall
How this headship is to be exercised
Lovingly and sacrificially
As Jesus Christ rules as head of the church
Regarding his wife as part of himself
Christian wives are to submit to their husbands
They are to follow the example of the submission of the church to Jesus Christ
Fathers are heads of their families
Fathers' authority is to be exercised reasonably
The response of children to parental authority
Obedience
Respect
Kinds of authority within the family
Authority to discipline
Authority to teach
Authority to command
authority, of human institutions
children.comment: The exercise of God-established freedom to regulate society for the good of its members.

children.title: Without authority sin is unrestrained

seealsos.comment: This was before the giving of the law

children.title: All human authorities are instituted and established by God
Rulers are God's servants to do good and restrain evil
The proper response to human authorities
They are to be obeyed by everyone
They are to be honoured and respected
They are not to be obeyed if their demands conflict with the law of God
They are to be prayed for
Christians are to use rights granted by the authorities
authority, abuse of
children.comment: The misuse of a person's freedom of action in order to exploit, oppress or treat other people in a way that is not for their good.

children.title: Warnings against the abuse of authority
By employers over employees
By fathers over children
By husbands over wives
By elders over the church
By those mistreating foreigners
By leaders over those who are led
By those taking advantage of the helpless or poor
By those who oppress others
Examples of the abuse of authority
